Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] #deletebinobj going from 15.9 to master" (#3172) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I setup a new #deletebinobj "regression protection" test:

* Created the Master/Detail Xamarin.Forms template from Visual Studio
  2017 15.9
* Built it with 15.9
* Zipped it up, and uploaded to Azure

I created 4 zips: Debug & Release, Windows & Darwin.

Next I created an `ExistingProject` type in `Xamarin.ProjectTools`, so
I could unzip these files and build them.

Unfortunately this found a bug:

    Task CompileToDalvik
    ...
    Xamarin.Android.Common.targets(2805,3): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: already added :  Lmono/android/Seppuku;

`Seppuku.java` was another file we missed when creating the
`_CleanupOldStaticResources` target.

This fix we can hopefully backport to 16.2. I plan to make further
changes to `DeleteBinObjTest.cs` in other PRs. It should start apps
and connect the debugger like we are doing in other tests.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] <Aapt2Link/> don't check for compiled.flata" (#3171) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/3169
Context: https://github.com/zijianhuang/xamarinforms4bugs/tree/ResourcesInLib

We discovered a solution that crashes on startup when it is built with
`$(AndroidUseAapt2)=True`:

    Java.Lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed resolution of: Landroid/support/v7/appcompat/R$drawable; ---> Java.Lang.ClassNotFoundException: Didn't find class "android.support.v7.appcompat.R$drawable" on path: DexPathList[[zip file "/system/framework/org.apache.http.legacy.boot.jar", zip file "/data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/base.apk"],nativeLibraryDirectories=[/data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/lib/arm64, /data/app/com.companyname.Demo2.Android-PozTNMz4ZBMXaHx-doetdQ==/base.apk!/lib/arm64-v8a, /system/lib64]]
        --- End of inner exception stack trace ---
        at Java.Interop.JniEnvironment+InstanceMethods.CallNonvirtualVoidMethod (Java.Interop.JniObjectReference instance, Java.Interop.JniObjectReference type, Java.Interop.JniMethodInfo method, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* args) [0x00089] in <372c976a2c5d45cb9abb001729e14dbf>:0
        at Java.Interop.JniPeerMembers+JniInstanceMethods.InvokeVirtualVoidMethod (System.String encodedMember, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable self, Java.Interop.JniArgumentValue* parameters) [0x0005d] in <372c976a2c5d45cb9abb001729e14dbf>:0
        at Android.App.Activity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x00031] in <547679cba0d64c03859bc6ab9919a165>:0
        at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.FormsAppCompatActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x0001d] in <02288cf327c341c79f8385d5db4c09bf>:0
        at Demo2.Droid.MainActivity.OnCreate (Android.OS.Bundle savedInstanceState) [0x00001] in <16681ab0b39d4abe8efd53e748c930e4>:0
        at Android.App.Activity.n_OnCreate_Landroid_os_Bundle_ (System.IntPtr jnienv, System.IntPtr native__this, System.IntPtr native_savedInstanceState) [0x00011] in <547679cba0d64c03859bc6ab9919a165>:0
        at (wrapper dynamic-method) Android.Runtime.DynamicMethodNameCounter.7(intptr,intptr,intptr)
        --- End of managed Java.Lang.NoClassDefFoundError stack trace ---

This solution is setup in an odd way:

* NetStandard library with Xamarin.Forms/xplat code
* Android head project, where `@(AndroidResource)` is empty
* Android class library with all the resources, activity, etc.

The root cause being that `<Aapt2Link/>` was completely skipped, due
to this condition:

    <Aapt2Link Condition="'$(_AndroidResourceDesignerFile)' != '' And '$(_AndroidUseAapt2)' == 'True' And Exists ('$(_AndroidLibraryFlatArchivesDirectory)\compiled.flata')" ...

The `compiled.flata` file does not exist, because there are no
`@(AndroidResource)` files.

The fix here is to simply remove the `Exists` check; I also added a
new test for this scenario.

There is some further weirdness in this area I will fix in future PRs.
For now, this will be a good patch we could cherry-pick to 16.2.

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue ""Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR)" native fault during C# exception handling on ARM64 devices" (#3112) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Debug app on device
2. App deploys
3. App tries to launch but crashes immediately

### Expected Behavior
No crash

### Actual Behavior
App crashes immediately when trying to debug on target device.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Aapt2] Can't operate across drives on Windows" (#1771) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

See VSTS build here: http://build.devdiv.io/1735992

1. Create a project into `E:\` or some secondary drive with Aapt2 enabled
2. Your system has `%TEMP%` in `C:\`
3. `aapt2.exe` fails an error such as:

```
error APT0000: failed to create directory 'C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\3\hyxjnzdb.0d1\xamarin\forms_performance_integration'.
```

Apparently, because we are running `aapt2.exe` against files on different drives:
```
Executing package -f -m -M C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\3\mbhhnawt.shy\manifest\AndroidManifest.xml -J C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\3\mbhhnawt.shy --custom-package mono.android_tests -F C:\Users\myuser\AppData\Local\Temp\3\mbhhnawt.shy\resources.apk.bk -S E:\A\_work\1\s\src\Mono.Android\Test\obj\\Debug\res -S E:\A\_work\1\s\src\Mono.Android\Test\obj\Debug\lp\1\jl\res -S E:\A\_work\1\s\src\Mono.Android\Test\obj\Debug\lp\2\jl\res -S E:\A\_work\1\s\src\Mono.Android\Test\obj\Debug\lp\3\jl\res -I C:\Users\myuser\android-toolchain\sdk\platforms\android-27\android.jar --auto-add-overlay --output-text-symbols obj\\Debug\ --max-res-version 27
```

Other links about this:
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46512990/gradle-error-failed-to-create-directory
- https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/68936311
- https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/1757

### Expected Behavior

`Aapt2` works even if you have the project on a second drive.

### Actual Behavior

`Aapt` fails.

### Version Information

I was using `xamarin-android/master/1cbac614061df022d93fcff2384afdbba813e37e`.

Don't know what we should even do about this, but I thought I would file it...

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] [CustomRenderer] [iOS] View.Bounds all 0 OnElementChanged" (#6372) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Custom Renderer for a grandient background stopped working when upgrading to Xamarin Forms 4.x.x (from 3.6.x). View.Bounds width, height all 0

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create custom iOS renderer deriving from PageRenderer class
2. Add override to OnElementChanged
3. Add code to render a grandient background

```
base.OnElementChanged(e);

            if (e.OldElement == null) // perform initial setup
            {
                var page = e.NewElement as GradientContentPage;

                var gradientLayer = new CAGradientLayer
                {
                    Frame = View.Bounds,
                    Colors = new CGColor[] { page.StartColor.ToCGColor(), page.EndColor.ToCGColor() }
                };

                View.Layer.InsertSublayer(gradientLayer, 0);
            }

```
### Expected Behavior
View.Bounds hat the actual width and height of the view. Adding a new CAGradientLayer used View.Bounds and had the current view's size.

### Actual Behavior
View.Bounds are all 0 (width, height) and thus the new Layer is not displayed (means: it's width and height are both 0)

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.425677
- Last known good version: 3.6.x
- IDE: Visual Studio for Mac 8.8.8 (build 2)
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  12.2
- Nuget Packages: FFImageLoading
- Affected Devices: iPhone

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug] iOS effect no longer works after upgrading to XF 4.0 since UIView.Bounds has no size in PlatformEffect.OnAttached()" (#6334) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I created an effect to add a gradient background to a UI element that no longer works in iOS after upgrading to XF 4.0 (the effect continued to work on Android). The cause of the issue is that the `UIView.Bounds` property started returning a `CGRect` with no size in the `PlatformEffect.OnAttached()` method.

I am working around this issue by rolling back to XF 3.6.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an iOS `PlatformEffect` and apply it to a `ContentPage`.
2. Set breakpoint in `OnAttached()` method.

### Expected Behavior
`Container.Bounds` should have the same size as the `ContentPage`.

### Actual Behavior
`Container.Bounds` has no size (i.e. height and width are both 0).

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 4.0.0.425677
- Last known good version: 3.6.0.344457
- IDE: VisualStudio

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin.Forms WPF is broken with higher version than 4.0.0.425677 [Bug] " (#6399) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Xamarin.Forms iOS, Android, UWP and WPF worked well with Xamarin.Forms v 4.0.0.425677. But after updating to any higher version of nuget Xamarin.Forms.Platform.WPF + Xamarin.Forms (E.g. 4.0.0.482894, June 3 2019) than WPF application starts with black screen, without any exception or any debug output error.

- Version with issue: v 4.0.0.482894
- Last known good version: v 4.0.0.425677
- IDE: VS2017

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[iOS] Fix Bounds for PageContainer " (#6405) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

We introduced a wrapper PageContainer and doing so we override the default LoadView of our PageRenderer ViewController. 

The default method provided a UIView with a Frame and Bounds, while our PageContainer doesn't provide one when it's created. Since our effects are attached when we set the elements for reuse on renderers when the user access the Bounds of the container there are not set ,while in previous versions there were (even if wrong ) .
Since these are related with size even previous versions should be using not the attach only but also the OnElementPropertyChanged or other methods to update there frame if the size changes. 


After some testing seems that the default size that was provided was the UIScreen even if inside a NavigationPage, this also is not very important as the Frame will be updated later on chain ViewWillLayoutSubviews.
### Issues Resolved ### 
<!-- Please use the format "fixes #xxxx" for each issue this PR addresses -->

- fixes #6334
- fixes #6372

### API Changes ###
<!-- List all API changes here (or just put None), example:

Added:
 - string ListView.GroupName { get; set; } //Bindable Property
 - int ListView.GroupId { get; set; } // Bindable Property
 - void ListView.Clear ();

Changed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 Removed:
 - object ListView.SelectedItem => Cell ListView.SelectedItem
 
 -->
 
 None

### Platforms Affected ### 
<!-- Please list all platforms affected by these changes -->

- iOS

### Behavioral/Visual Changes ###
<!-- Describe any changes that may change how a user's app behaves or appears when upgrading to this version of the codebase. -->

None

### Before/After Screenshots ### 
<!-- If possible, take a screenshot of your test case before these changes were made and another screenshot after the changes were made to show possible visual changes. -->

Not applicable

### Testing Procedure ###
<!-- Please list the steps that should be taken to properly test these changes on each relevant platform. If you were unable to test these changes yourself on any or all platforms, please let us know. Also, if you are able to attach a video of your test run, you will be our personal hero. -->

Should visit Issue 6334 and see a gradient and Success message.

- [ ] Has automated tests <!-- (if tests are omitted or manual, state reason in description) -->
- [ ] Rebased on top of the target branch at time of PR
- [ ] Changes adhere to coding standard

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Bump min iOS version to 8.0" (#6213) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
It seems Xcode 11 drops support for iOS versions < 8.0

So we'll have to do the same.

* [ ] Fix Make.config
* [ ] Remove dead errors/warnings/logic from mtouch
* [ ] Fix test projects / templates.
* [ ] IDE?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[tests] Backport xtro changes to xcode11" (#6209) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Changes:

 2e295036 (Rolf Bjarne Kvinge, 4 days ago)
    [xtro] 'raw' files might not exist. (#6191)

    If we just fixed all the entries in the corresponding '*.ignore' file,
    there won't be a '*.raw' file.

 309da40e (Rolf Bjarne Kvinge, 7 days ago)
    [xtro] Implement support for auto-sanitizing the .ignore files by defining
    an environment variable. (#6158)

    Going through each failure one-by-one after fixing something that fixed
    many entries is annoying, so automate the process.
